info.title: VAT API v1
info.description: API for VAT UID validation, state retrieval, history, and search.

get.summary: Get analytics for the authenticated user's company
get.description: Returns analytics data for the authenticated user's company
Returns validation, geographic, AI, time-based, and business insights with optional filters.

parameters.name: account_id

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Filter analytics by API key (plaintext or hashed)

parameters.name: critical_threshold
parameters.description: Failure rate threshold for highlighting critical countries (0-1)

post.description: Authenticates the user and returns an access token.

email.description: User email address. Required when client_id is not provided.

client_id.description: API user identifier. Required when email is not provided.

get.description: Returns the company information for the authenticated user

delete.summary: Deactivate company account and delete allowable data

get.summary: List users of the current company
get.description: Returns all users that belong to the authenticated user's company. Requires Merchant Admin or Readonly permissions.

put.description: Creates an AUTH type user in the current company and optionally assigns roles. Only Merchant Admins can create users.

roles.description: List of role identifiers to assign. Each item can be a role ID (integer) or a role name (string), e.g. 'backend-merchant-admin'.

post.description: Checks if a VAT UID is valid. If the AI company-name score is near zero and addressLine1 is provided, Taxora retries scoring by using addressLine1 as company-name candidate and keeps the better deterministic result.

company_name.description: The company name to validate against the VAT UID

addressLine1.description: Optional first address line. Used as fallback company-name candidate only when company_name scoring is near zero.

provider.description: The VAT provider to use for validation. Possible values: 'fon' (Fon), 'vies' (Vies), 'uk_hmrc' (UK HMRC), 'ai_search' (AI Search), 'fon_vies_ai_search' (Fon + Vies + AI Search), 'uk_hmrc_ai_search' (UK HMRC + AI Search), 'fon_ai_search' (Fon + AI Search), 'fon_vies' (Fon + Vies), 'vies_ai_search' (Vies + AI Search). Default is null.

addressLineFallback.summary: Fallback case: company is in addressLine1

post.description: Checks if multiple VAT UIDs are valid and returns their validation status.

vat_uids.description: An array of VAT UIDs to validate

company_names.description: An optional array of company names to validate against the VAT UIDs (order should match vat_uids array)

provider.description: The VAT provider to use for validation. Possible values: 'fon' (Fon), 'vies' (Vies), 'uk_hmrc' (UK HMRC), 'ai_search' (AI Search), 'fon_vies_ai_search' (Fon + Vies + AI Search), 'uk_hmrc_ai_search' (UK HMRC + AI Search), 'fon_ai_search' (Fon + AI Search), 'fon_vies' (Fon + Vies), 'vies_ai_search' (Vies + AI Search). Default is null.

post.description: Validates if the given VAT UID follows the correct format and schema based on country-specific VAT rules.

vat_uid.description: The VAT UID to be validated

valid.description: Indicates whether the VAT UID is valid

error.example: Invalid format: A VAT UID must start with two uppercase letters.

post.summary: Get the state of a VAT UID
post.description: Retrieves the current state of a VAT UID.

parameters.name: vat_uid
parameters.description: VAT UID to check

post.description: Retrieves VAT history entries. Supports filtering by VAT UID, search term, and date range with pagination.

parameters.name: vat_uid
parameters.description: VAT UID to retrieve history for (optional)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term: if it's a valid VAT UID, performs an exact VAT UID match; otherwise searches by company name

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Filter results from this date (YYYY-MM-DD). If no date range is supplied and no VAT UID is specified, defaults to the last 12 months.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Filter results up to this date (YYYY-MM-DD). If no date range is supplied and no VAT UID is specified, defaults to the last 12 months.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of results per page

get.description: Retrieves a single VAT history entry by its UUID. Supports fetching from sandbox when environment is SANDBOX.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the VAT history entry

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Select the environment to read from. Defaults to LIVE.

get.summary: Download FON XML for VAT history entries
get.description: Returns the FON XML containing only the requested VAT history entries. All entries must belong to the same FON XML document.

parameters.name: uuids
parameters.description: VAT history UUIDs to include

message.example: History entry is not backed by a FON XML document.

post.description: Find VAT records based on search filters.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter VAT records

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of results per page

post.description: Generates a downloadable PDF certificate for a validated VAT ID based on the provided UUID. The certificate language defaults to English if not specified.

uuid.description: Unique identifier of the VAT validation request.

lang.description: (Optional) Language for the generated PDF certificate. Allowed values: 'en' (English), 'de' (German). Defaults to 'en' if not provided.

items.example: The selected language is invalid. Allowed values: 'en', 'de'.

post.summary: Initiate Bulk Export of VAT Certificates
post.description: Initiates an asynchronous process to export multiple VAT certificates for a company within a date range. The process generates a ZIP file containing all certificates and sends an email with a download link when complete.

from_date.description: Start date for the export range (YYYY-MM-DD)

to_date.description: End date for the export range (YYYY-MM-DD)

countries.description: Optional array of country codes to filter by (e.g. ['DE', 'AT'])

lang.description: Optional language for the certificates. Allowed values: 'en' (English), 'de' (German). Defaults to 'en' if not provided.

include_documents.description: Include provider documents (combined XML, screenshots as zip entries) in the export archive

message.example: VAT certificates export initiated. You will receive an email with a download link when the export is complete.

export_id.description: Unique identifier for the export job

items.example: The from date field is required.
The to date field is required.
The selected language is invalid. Allowed values: 'en', 'de'.

get.description: Downloads the requested VAT certificates export (ZIP archive with certificates or single PDF list) if it belongs to the authenticated company.

parameters.name: exportId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the export job

200.description: ZIP archive with certificates or single PDF list

message.example: Export job does not belong to the company

post.summary: Initiate List Export of VAT Checks
post.description: Initiates an asynchronous process that creates a single PDF listing VAT checks in the given period.

include_documents.description: Include provider documents (combined XML, screenshots as zip entries) in the export archive

parameters.description: UUID of the VAT request history record

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: HMAC verification token from the QR code

permissions.description: List of permissions assigned to the user

VatSandboxTestData.title: Sandbox VAT Test Data
VatSandboxTestData.description: Static VAT UIDs available in sandbox and development environments for testing integration flows.

valid_vat_uids.description: VAT numbers that always return a valid response in sandbox/development mode.

invalid_vat_uids.description: VAT numbers that always return an invalid response in sandbox/development mode.

notes.description: Additional guidance for consumers using the sandbox test UIDs.
notes.example: Use these VAT numbers when calling /v1/vat/validate or /v1/vat/validate-multiple in sandbox or development environments to receive deterministic mock responses.

VatResource.title: VAT Resource
VatResource.description: Response structure for a VAT request

uuid.description: Unique identifier for the VAT record

state.description: State of the VAT number (e.g., VALID, INVALID, NOT_FOUND)

country_code.description: Country code of the VAT registration

company_name.description: Registered company name for the VAT number

provider.description: Upstream provider used to process the VAT request when available

used_providers.description: Collection of upstream providers that participated in the validation run

requested_company_name.description: Effective company-name candidate used for scoring. If addressLine1 fallback was selected, this equals addressLine1.

requested_company_name_original.description: Original company_name received from the API request.

requested_input_address.description: Normalized address input received from the API request.

checked_at.description: Timestamp of the last VAT check

environment.description: Environment where the VAT validation was executed (e.g. LIVE or SANDBOX)

score.description: Risk Score! 100 OK, 50 Could be fraud...

breakdown.description: Detailed breakdown of the score calculation

score_source.description: Source used for the final AI name score (companyName, addressLine1Fallback, or addressLine2Fallback).

score_attempts.description: Debug view of executed score attempts.

provider_vat_state.description: Latest VAT state reported by the upstream provider when available

provider_note.description: Explanatory note included when the provider state differs from the validation result
provider_note.example: Provider reports VAT Number is valid, but the check failed (e.g., name/address mismatch).

provider_last_checked_at.description: Timestamp of the most recent upstream provider confirmation

provider_document.description: Deprecated: use provider_documents instead. This field will be removed in the next API version. For history entries, the document is resolved via explicit history links and may exist without a provider request.

provider_documents.description: All linked provider documents (may include multiple providers/types). For history entries, links are created even when no provider request exists.

ApiKeyAuth.description: API key required for all requests. Provide the key via the x-api-key header.
ApiKeyAuth.name: x-api-key

bearerAuth.description: JWT access token returned by /v1/login. Use as Authorization: Bearer <token>.

tags.name: VAT
tags.description: Endpoints related to VAT operations. Sandbox & development environment users can reference the VatSandboxTestData schema for ready-to-use test VAT UIDs.
